title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When performing certain actions in the Java editor, the 'Revert' feature takes significantly longer to execute compared to the 'Close and Reopen' feature.
OB:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Answer 'no' to the 'Do you want to save changes' dialog.
2. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
3. However, if I repeat steps 1 and 2, and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
SR:
1. Open a file in the Java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Save the file.
4. Close the file without saving.
5. Reopen the file by double-clicking on it in the navigator.
6. Observe the time it takes to open the file.
7. Repeat steps 4-6.
8. This time, select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
9. Observe the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original.
